db:info.db:title: Qt Quick Examples - Drag and Drop

db:abstract.db:para: This is a collection of QML drag and drop examples.

db:article.db:para: Drag and Drop is a collection of small QML examples relating to the drag and drop functionality. For more information, visit the Drag and Drop page.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, visit Building and Running an Example.

db:section.db:title: Tiles
db:section.db:para: Tiles adds drag and drop to simple rectangles, which you can drag into a specific grid.
It has a DragTile component which uses a MouseArea to move an item when dragged:
And a DropTile component on which the dragged tiles can be dropped:
The keys property of the DropArea will only allow an item to be dropped on it if it has a matching key in its Drag.keys property.

db:section.db:title: GridView Example
db:section.db:para: The GridView Example adds drag and drop to a GridView, allowing you to reorder the list. It also uses a DelegateModel to move a delegate item to the position of another item it is dragged over.
